ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I feel SO much more confident reading, interpreting, and speculating research papers now. My understanding of statistics and their interpretation is very solid, and I think that this helps me be a better STEM student in being able to interpret studies for myself. This class obviously taught calculations, which are helpful in gaining hands-on experience in statistics and data-interpretation.
Lots of intro stats topics like hypothesis testing, p values, confidence intervals, studies, etc.
I learned a good amount of intro info in the main course
I have learned a lot in this course regarding everyday statistics and statistics specifically used in the medical world. I have learned how to correctly evaluate and present sets of data.
Basic statistical analysis, how to read medical studies, other useful concepts.
I learned about the basics of how to calculate and interpret various statistical information, particularly in the context of a greater problem.
basic statistical analysis skills, better understanding of diagnostic testing and medical journals
How to read a medicinal research paper and analyze the significance of the numbers they were displaying.
I was able to learn about intro statistics and certain medical studies.
I know have a good basis of knowledge on statistics. The course did exactly as advertised! It was a great introductory course.
Statistics & Medicine
I learned basic stats.
Introduction to basic statistical methods of analyzing data. Normal distributions, Binomial and Poisson distributions, sampling and experiments, hypothesis testing, and confidence intervals.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I enjoyed how this class was structured and tailored to my interests. I appreciated that the class read and discussed research papers and the different types of research. I do think that the first 8 weeks helped me gain a significant foundation of statistics, but I really enjoyed the latter bit in which I was able to apply my knowledge to things I was interested in. The material we discussed was interesting and applicable, and the assignments were engaging and I often found them interesting and fun!
It was great!! Very fair pset, final, and concepts. Definitely better than stats 100.
strengths: lots of office hours and recorded lectures--> being able to take this course asynchronously for the first half

I like that we break off into the more focused stats groups for the rest fo the semester. I wish that we had a final project instead of a final exam and feel that could have better helped us to think through the concepts of med stats through the collection, organization and analysis or med related content.
It had the info easy to access on the website

The first half of the course was well spread out and I learned a lot. However, the second half of the course felt rushed and it was much harder for me to absorb the intended information. I did appreciate the smaller class size for the specialized part of the class.
I would appreciate more discussion of past medical trials
Strengths: very context-based! All of the data we looked at came from recent medical papers which made it much easier to understand the math and interpret the figures.
i think it was a great class! thorough explanations, interesting examples and intriguing professor
This course was useful in learning beginner concepts. However, certain topics could be repetitive.
The strengths of the course is the amount of knowledge acquired.
Strengths: I thought the course material was very relevant and interesting.

The option to watch videos instead of going to class was great for people who couldn't make it to class. It was easy to get left behind because it requires a lot of discipline to watch the videos instead of going to class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I think a knowledge of statistics is important in any field, but especially in STEM as it allows you to understand research greater. This class is engaging, and I often found it fun!
Yes, if you need this as a pre-med or for another requirement. Also this is helpful if you are planning on doing research.
Yes
Yes, I think that this is an important introductory course for all majors. It was very informative and a lot of the information with be useful for the future of all STEM majors.
Yes. Good class and easy class.
Absolutely! If you're interested in medicine at all, this course is a great way to expose yourself to scientific papers and the data they present.
definitely! great intro to statistics course and very helpful if you want to go into the medical field
I do think statistics is a knowledge that can be applied to many careers, so if someone was in need of a math credit, I would recommend it.
I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who is pre-med. You will be equipped with the tools to read all kinds of medical studies and make your own analyses!
Yes, it provided me a better understanding of how statistics inform medicine.
If you have to take a math, Id recommend stats.
Yes. Especially for students who will need to be analyzing data in any way.
Yes. It taught me more about the statistics from a medical point of view.
